property.name: grill.persistent.resultset
property.description: Whether to enable persistent resultset for queries. When enabled, server will fetch results from driver, custom format them if any and store in a configured location. The file name of query output is queryhandle-id, with configured extensions

property.name: grill.result.parent.dir
property.description: The directory for storing persisted result of query. This directory should exist and should have writable permissions by grill server

property.name: grill.add.insert.overwrite
property.description: Prefix query with insert overwrite clause if the query is persistent. User can disable if user gave the clause himself.

property.name: grill.persistent.resultset.indriver
property.description: Whether the result should be persisted by driver. Currently only HiveDriver persists the results in a HDFS location.

property.name: grill.result.output.dir.format
property.description: The format of the output if result is persisted in hdfs. The format should be expressed in HQL.

property.name: grill.query.hdfs.output.path
property.description: The directory under the parent result directory, in which HiveDriver will persist the results, if persisting by driver is enabled. This directory should exist and should have world writable permissions sothat all users will be able put query outputs here.

property.name: grill.query.output.formatter
property.description: The query result output formatter for the query. If no value is specified, then com.inmobi.grill.lib.query.FileSerdeFormatter will be used to format in-memory result sets, com.inmobi.grill.lib.query.FilePersistentFormatter will be used to format driver persisted result sets.

property.name: grill.result.output.serde
property.description: The default serde class name that should be used by com.inmobi.grill.lib.query.FileSerdeFormatter for formatting the output

property.name: grill.query.output.file.extn
property.description: The extension name for the persisted query output file. If file is compressed, the extension from compression codec will be appended to this extension.

property.name: grill.query.output.charset.encoding
property.description: The charset encoding for formatting query result. It supports all the encodings supported by java.io.OutputStreamWriter.

property.name: grill.query.output.enable.compression
property.description: Whether to compress the query result output

property.name: grill.query.output.compression.codec
property.description: The codec used to compress the query output, if compression is enabled

property.name: grill.query.output.write.header
property.description: Whether to write header as part of query result formatting. When enabled the user given header will be added in case of driver persisted results, and column names chosen will be added as header for in-memory results.

property.name: grill.query.output.header
property.description: The value of custom header that should be written, if any. If no value column names will be used as header.

property.name: grill.query.output.write.footer
property.description: Whether to write footer as part of query result. When enabled, total number of rows will be written as part of header.

property.name: grill.query.output.footer
property.description: The value of custom footer that should be written, if any. This footer will be added in formatting driver persisted results.

property.name: grill.query.result.size.format.threshold
property.description: The maximum allowed size of the query result. If exceeds, no server side formatting would be done.

property.name: grill.query.result.split.multiple
property.description: Whether to split the result into multiple files. If enabled, each file will be restricted to max rows configured. All the files will be available as zip.

property.name: grill.query.result.split.multiple.maxrows
property.description: The maximum number of rows allowed in each file, when splitting the result into multiple files is enabled.

property.name: grill.query.result.fs.read.url
property.description: Http read URL for FileSystem on which result is present, if available. For example webhdfs as http read url should http://host:port/webhdfs/v1. Currently we support only webhdfs url as the http url for HDFS file system

property.name: grill.query.result.email.cc
property.description: When query ends, the result/failure reason will be sent to the user via email. The mail would be cc'ed to the addresses provided in this field.

property.name: grill.aux.jars
property.description: List of comma separated jar paths, which will added to the session

property.name: grill.whether.mail.notify
property.description: When a query ends, whether to notify the submitter by mail or not.
